subject: Learning
title: Multitasking While Studying
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on Multitasking While Studying.

hook.text: You're studying with music, texting friends, and checking social media. You feel efficient.

buildup.text: The brain doesn't actually multitask. It rapidly switches between tasks, losing time on each switch.

discovery.text: Each context switch costs 15â€“25% of your cognitive efficiency. The losses add up fast.

twist.text: Students who multitask while studying score significantly lower and take longer to complete the same work.

climax.text: The feeling of productivity during multitasking is itself the illusion. You're doing more but learning less.

punchline.text: Multitasking is just rapid failure at two things.
